data.title: Sky Italia appeals DAZN winning Serie A rights
data.meta_description: Sky Italia has filed an appeal with a Milan court that seeks to
data.text:
Related Story

Sky Italia has filed an appeal with a Milan court that seeks to "block" the awarding of the '21-24 Serie A TV rights to DAZN. Following the March 26 award, Sky Italia had anticipated being awarded rights to "three weekly matches on a non-exclusive basis, but was refused." In its appeal, Sky Italia alleges the violation of the so-called "Melandri Law" that prohibits a single operator from "acquiring all the rights" to Serie A matches. Sky Italia has since announced plans to "reduce staff by a quarter" and its CEO, Maximo Ibarra, will leave the company in July. The court hearing is scheduled to "take place on May 5" (IL SOLE 24 ORE, 4/22).
